data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is the same as the beginning point. Each step takes an opposite direction. A backward step takes the opposite direction as the forward step. If the right half of a step takes a step forward, we call it a forward step. If the left side of a step takes a step left, we call it a backward step. So, the answer is no.

If you turn around, going back to the starting point is not possible. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps back to the beginning. Take 2 steps back to the beginning. Take 9 steps to the beginning and back. So, the answer is Yes.
